tasks: Create a list of 10 common UX principles and explain how they can be applied to a design project, referencing the Laws of UX resources (https://lawsofux.com/). Focus on clarifying your understanding of these principles in relation to your current score gap in UX Fundamentals (48%). (Measurable: 1-2 pages written, Score improvement: +5%)

Conduct a self-assessment exercise using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (https://www.nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/) to identify areas where you can improve your design process. Document 3 specific heuristics and provide examples of how they apply to your current work, focusing on error states or missed opportunities. (Measurable: 1-2 pages written, Score improvement: +5%)

Create a visual representation of the Aesthetic-Usability Effect (https://lawsofux.com/aesthetic-usability-effect/) and explain its significance in UX design. Use this concept to redesign a simple UI element, such as a button or form field, incorporating the effect into your design decisions. (Measurable: 1-2 pages written, Score improvement: +5%)

Develop a comprehensive plan to improve Collaboration & Communication skills, including strategies for active listening, clear documentation, and effective feedback. Implement these strategies in a real-world project or with a colleague, tracking progress and results. (Measurable: 2-3 pages written, Score improvement: +10%)

resources.readup: As a UX practitioner, you have the power to shape the user experience and create products that delight and empower people. Focus on building your skills in User Research & Validation, Collaboration & Communication, and Product Thinking & Strategy to take your design career to the next level.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Tesler’s Law in UI Design
topics.summary: Tesler’s Law states that the more information is presented at once, the less easily it can be understood. Practitioners will apply this law to optimize their designs and improve user experience.
practice_points: Create a wireframe with 5-7 main sections and document how Tesler’s Law affects the design's usability

Conduct an A/B test to compare two versions of a UI element: one with more information presented at once, and another with less. Analyze the results and apply Tesler’s Law to improve the winning version
Design a new feature or page that incorporates Tesler’s Law, ensuring that it is intuitive and easy to use

topics.name: Improving Collaboration through Clear Communication
topics.summary: Effective collaboration requires clear communication among team members. Practitioners will focus on improving their communication skills to enhance teamwork and project outcomes.
practice_points: Create a guide for communicating design decisions to non-design stakeholders, including examples of successful communication strategies
Record a 10-minute video explaining your design process and decisions to a colleague or peer. Share the recording with feedback and discuss areas for improvement
Participate in a virtual design meeting where you will present your work and receive feedback from colleagues. Practice active listening and ask clarifying questions

topics.name: Applying the Law of Proximity in Visual Design
topics.summary: The Law of Proximity states that related elements should be grouped together to improve usability. Practitioners will apply this law to create more intuitive and user-friendly designs.
practice_points: Design a new navigation menu with related links grouped together, using the Law of Proximity to guide your decisions
Conduct an analysis of existing UI elements on a website or app, identifying areas where the Law of Proximity could be applied to improve usability. Propose changes and document the results
Create a visual design system that incorporates the Law of Proximity, ensuring consistency across different pages and features
